StorytellerDef.label: Vault Girl
StorytellerDef.description: She emerged from Vault 84 with technical manuals and a optimistic smile, believing every settlement can thrive with proper preparation. Her experience in controlled vault environments means she understands the balance between challenge and survival - threats come in measured waves with breathing room between, giving you time to fortify, heal, and prepare. She'll test you with raiders and wasteland creatures, but she wants you to succeed.

StorytellerDef.label: Ranger Rick
StorytellerDef.description: A veteran Desert Ranger who's survived everything the Mojave could throw at him through a mix of skill, grit, and sheer dumb luck. Rick brings a ranger's perspective to colony leadership - constant vigilance, regular patrols (threats), and the importance of strong faction relationships. Expect steady pressure balanced with frequent caravans and diplomatic opportunities. He'll join your colony personally if you prove worthy through a special quest. The wasteland is tough, but rangers are tougher.

StorytellerDef.label: Vault Boy
StorytellerDef.description: The ever-present mascot of Vault-Tec Corporation, representing the true purpose behind the vaults - controlled experiments on human populations. Unlike his optimistic counterpart, Vault Boy's corporate algorithms favor rapid testing and variable conditions. Expect shorter cycles between threats with occasional surprise double incidents, mixed with frequent opportunities for trade and social development. Every settlement is just another data point in the grand experiment.

StorytellerDef.label: Augustus Autumn
StorytellerDef.description: Colonel Autumn of the Enclave leads with military precision and overwhelming technological force. His doctrine emphasizes relentless pressure, mechanized warfare, and genetic superiority. Threats arrive in coordinated waves with minimal recovery time, forcing you to maintain constant combat readiness. Expect mechanoid incursions, genetic manipulation opportunities, and diseases that test colony resilience. This is war, and Autumn doesn't negotiate with inferior specimens.

StorytellerDef.label: Tabitha
StorytellerDef.description: The schizophrenic Nightkin leader from Black Mountain now narrates your colony's fate through her fractured consciousness. Rhonda, her imaginary Mr. Handy companion, whispers dark truths about things lurking beyond perception. Tabitha's episodes create wildly erratic threat patterns - days of supernatural horror followed by unexplained calm, with entities and anomalies that defy wasteland logic. Her madness sees connections others cannot, drawing forth eldritch phenomena and twisted experiments. Best Friends forever!

StorytellerDef.label: Father Elijah
StorytellerDef.description: A brilliant but utterly mad scientist obsessed with pre-war technology and utterly contemptuous of human life. Elijah sees people as tools - expendable pieces in his grand designs. He'll isolate you, trap you with scarcity and danger, and force you to raid ancient ruins for treasures. He's methodical and calculating, layering multiple threats while cutting you off from easy escape. Let go - but don't expect mercy. Finding the gravship is everything.
